alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Irion; Schleicher; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 3:04AM CDT until March 24 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Crockett, Irion, Schleicher and Tom Green. * WHEN...Until 515 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 304 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Angelo, Mertzon, Ozona, Christoval, Sherwood, Knickerbocker, Tankersley, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Lake Nasworthy, Us-190 Near The Crockett-Sutton County Line, The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 1828, The Intersection Of Us 190 And Highway 163, Us-67 Near The Irion-Tom Green County Line and The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 405. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 344 and 374. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Ranch Road 853 crossing east Rocky Creek, RM 853 crossing Dry Draw, County Road 202 crossing Lopez Creek, Sherwood Cemetery crossing, County Road 202 crossing Spring Creek, County Road 113 crossing Dove Creek, Mineral Wells crossing South Concho River, Door Key crossing Pecan Creek and crossings along County Road 401. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
